answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Q1 Next week at Harrison University, Charlie Klein will be conducting an introductory lecture on creative writing. It’s open to the public and it isn’t very expensive.
W: Charlie Klein? Q2 Doesn’t he currently have a book on the bestseller list? I heard his stories are very moving and powerful. I’d like to attend it.
M: Yes. I recently bought one of his books and was really impressed. That’s why I don’t want to miss this opportunity to learn from him. Would you like to read it before the lecture?
W: Sure. Q3 I’ll stop by your home tomorrow and pick up the book from you. Thanks for letting me know.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
Who is Charlie Klein?
Why is the woman planning to visit the man tomorrow?
choices: (D) To sign up for a course

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Hi, Lindy, Q1 Jessica just left to go home because she had a bad headache. I told her to take the day off tomorrow as well to go to the hospital. Q2 Do you think you could come in to fill in for her tomorrow morning?
W: Oh, I’m really sorry, but tomorrow I have to attend a close friend’s wedding. Q3 However, I’ll call around to see if any other employee is available to work tomorrow in place of Jessica.
M: OK, thanks. Just let me know immediately if you find somebody.

question.text: Why did Jessica leave work early?
choices: (D) She had to attend a wedding.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to do?
choices: (C) Deliver a presentation at a meeting

question.text: What will the woman do next?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: I saw an advertisement on the subway today for back pain relief at Frank Logan Hospital. The advertisement offers a free consultation to assess a patient’s situation and suggest a course of treatment. I’m thinking of going.
M: Q1 Actually, I was treated by Dr. Moran at the hospital for back pain last year. After five years of enduring the pain, my pain was drastically reduced under the care of Dr. Moran. In addition to medication, he showed me some useful stretching exercises. I really recommend seeing him.
W: You’re right. I shouldn’t hesitate anymore. Q2 My work is disrupted by my back pain almost every day.
M: Q3 If you would like, I can give you the number for Dr. Moran’s office. That way you can set up an appointment with him directly.

question.text: Who is Dr. Moran?
What problem does the woman mention?
What does the man offer to do?
choices: (B) Drive the woman to the hospital

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Wilmore Appliance customer service. How can I help you?
M: Hi, Q1 I’m having problems with the freezer part of my fridge. The temperature never goes below 5 degrees Celsius even when I set it below freezing.
W: Do you know the model number?
M: Let me check. It’s the Azura 783XB model.
W: Q2 Oh, I’m sorry but we no longer make that model so I can’t help you over the phone.
M: That’s going to be a problem. I purchased several gallons of ice cream for a party tomorrow.
W: I’m so sorry. Q3 I’ll send a technician over as soon as possible so that the problem is looked at. Will anyone be home at around 5:00 P.M. tonight?
M: Yes, I’ll be here.
W: Good. Our technician will be there between 5 and 6 tonight.

question.text: What problem does the man mention?
choices: (C) The freezer temperature is too high.
(D) Water is leaking from the fridge.

answer.text: (C) The freezer temperature is too high.

question.text: What does the woman mention about the fridge?
choices: (A) It is a very old model.
(C) It is not from their company.

question.text: What does the woman offer to do?
choices: (B) Give him a link to a website

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Sarah, I need your help. Q1 There is something wrong with the phone transfer software.
W: What exactly is the problem?
M: I can’t get through to Human Resources and Accounting. When I try to call through to them I just hear a strange noise and then the phone just goes silent.
W: Oh. They are on a different version now I think. Q2 You might need to update your software so it’s compatible with theirs.
M: Oh... Yeah, I haven’t updated for over a year.
W: That is definitely the problem then. Q3 I will send you the link for a free upgrade and you shouldn’t have any more problems.
M: Great! Thanks, Sarah!

question.text: What is the man concerned about?
What does the woman suggest?
What does the woman say she will do?
choices: (A) Send him a link for a free upgrade

answer.text: (A) Send him a link for a free upgrade

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Hi, Angela. I just got an e-mail from UHP incorporated. Q1 They are asking about installing the plumbing systems in their new offices. They want to know when we will begin.
W: Q2 I intended to call them today, but I’m waiting for a call from some workers. They are at the building site now testing the ground. Q3 It seems as though there may be some problems installing the pipes underground. We may need to dig deeper than we expected. I will let them know by this afternoon.
M: I see. I’ll call UHP and let them know the situation. They didn’t sound like they were angry, they were just curious to know what was going on. Let me know when you hear back from the workers.

question.text: Where do the speakers most likely work?
What does the woman mean when she says “I intended to call them today”?
choices: (A) She wasn’t going to call them.
(B) They were going to call her back.
(C) She was going to call them that day.
(D) She was going to send them an e-mail.

answer.text: (C) She was going to call them that day.

question.text: What is the problem?
choices: (C) There is some problems with the payment.
(D) They may need to dig deeper to install the plumbing.

answer.text: (D) They may need to dig deeper to install the plumbing.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: I’m concerned about the output of some of our machinery. Q1 Production has slowed by 8% since June. I think there must be a problem with the software. We are losing money over this, and I’m not sure who to ask about it.
W: We had it repaired once in the past but it was so expensive we ended up just buying a new one. Now it Is slowing down as well. Do you think we should just replace the machine again?
M: Q2 Yeah, it doesn’t make sense to keep going like this.
W: Q3 I’ll call the machine repair shop and get a quote on the repairs and we can decide what to do.
M: OK, but let’s get it done as quickly as possible please.

question.text: What is the man worried about?
choices: (B) The production rate of the machine

answer.text: (B) The production rate of the machine

question.text: What does the man imply when he says “It doesn’t make sense to keep going like this”?
choices: (A) He wants to take action immediately.
(B) He wants to continue business as usual,
(C) He wants to repair the software.
(D) He doesn’t agree with the woman.

answer.text: (A) He wants to take action immediately.

question.text: What does the woman say she will do?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hey Joe! Q1 How did your presentation go last weekend?
M: It was great! We sold a lot of books after the seminar.
W: Q2 Wow, sounds like you’ve really made it! So what are your plans for the future?
M: Q3 I’m writing another book now that is due for release next year, so I will just continue doing seminars and trying to get more exposure.
W: Excellent. If you need any help, let me know. I have a few connections in the publishing industry.

question.text: What did the man do last weekend?
What does the woman imply when she says “Wow, sounds like you’ve really made it!”?
choices: (B) He has been successful with his presentation.

answer.text: (B) He has been successful with his presentation.

question.text: What does the man plan on doing next year?
choices: (C) Have a child with his wife

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Okay sir, your total bill comes to one thousand dollars. Would you like to pay with cash or card?
M: One thousand dollars? Q1 Are you serious?
W: Yes sir. You ordered a lot of room service over the last few days and spend a lot of money at the downstairs bar and restaurant. Q2 You stayed in room 208, didn’t you?
M: No. I was in room 207.1 think you’ve made a mistake.
W: Oh, I’m sorry sir. Q3 I will give you a 10% discount next time you stay with us. I apologize for the confusion.

question.text: What does the man mean when he says “Are you serious?”
choices: (A) He believes the woman is correct.
(B) He doesn’t believe she is correct.
(C) He is going to pay by card.

answer.text: (B) He doesn’t believe she is correct.

question.text: What does the woman want to know?
choices: (A) How much room service he ordered
(B) She wants to clarify what room he stayed in.
(C) She wants to confirm his credit card number.

answer.text: (B) She wants to clarify what room he stayed in.

question.text: What does the woman offer to do?
choices: (A) Give him his room for free
(B) Give him a discount on his next visit

answer.text: (B) Give him a discount on his next visit

answer.explanation:
Script
M-Cn: Hi, this is Neil Chen, Q1 I just made an online reservation at your hotel, but when I saw the confirmation page, I realized that I’d made a mistake in the dates. Q2 Can I make a change?
W-Am: I’ll be happy to change your reservation provided we have a room available. Could you please give me your confirmation code?
M-Cn: Sure, it’s VF732. I want the reservation for the following weekend – January tenth through twelfth. Will the price be the same?
W-Am: Let me see. Yes, we do have a room available for that weekend at the same rate, so I’ve changed your booking with us. Q3 You can expect an updated confirmation in your e-mail shortly.

question.text: Where does the woman most likely work?
Why is the man calling?
What will the woman e-mail the man?
